results.title: The Cancer hunters
results.creator_credit: BBC, WBGH Boston, Andrew Liebman, Robin Brightwell and Paula S. Apsell
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Cracking the code”.
All forms of cancer are caused by faults in the genes. Our new understanding of what causes these faults is leading to revolutionary forms of treatment.

results.title: The Cancer gas
results.creator_credit: Granada International Productions and Alan Segal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Vinyl chloride monomer is a gas used in the making of PVC - one of the most common forms of plastic. Scientists now believe that workmen breathing the fumes of VCM can contract cancer of the liver.

results.title: The Canberra Lake: Springtime sixty-four
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Neil Howe and Visatone (Australia)
results.brief_description: Canberra, the national capital of Australia, has a man-made lake in the centre of the city. We see a working model of the lake, dam, flood-gates, various transport routes and bridges. The lake, designed by Walter Burley Griffin, was opened at the end of 1964. Shows the official opening and the use of the lake for water sports.

results.title: The Canadians
results.brief_description: The film traces Canada’s evolution, and the contributions of people at home and from many lands including Yousuf Karsh, Lester B. Pearson and Dr. Wilder Penfield. It explores the country from coast to coast and to the farthest reaches of the Arctic, bringing to the screen lively impressions of this second largest country in the world.

results.title: The Canadian shield: Saguenay region
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rene Jodoin and Werner Aellen
results.brief_description: This film focuses on the Saguenay area of Quebvec as seen from a helicopter. From this vantage point, the size and resources - wood, water, arable land and mineral-bearing rock are easy to see. At closer range the film shows the industries and agricultural development of the region.

results.title: The Campaign
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Frontline Television Productions, Debra Choate and Santo Cilauro
results.brief_description: The Campaign is a surprising political documentary where the anatomy of a federal campaign has been laid bare: the logistics, the travelling, the locations, the surroundings and the schedule. For the full 35 days of the 1996 Federal Election campaign, Santo Cilauro and his video-camera followed the then Prime Minister Paul Keating, his entourage and the media pack, around Australia to give a revealing insight into the physical nature of campaigning for the nation’s highest office. An inside view of how our view is formed in an era where the election battle is fought with the 15 second grab, this two part program is a dynamic display of how the moment is manufactured. Covering 35 days, 150 journalists, 40,000km, 11 million voters and one man in the middle, The Campaign shows why people describe Australian elections like no other in the world.

results.title: The Camp
results.creator_credit: United Nations, Stanley Wright and Georges Pessis
results.brief_description: Commentary spoken by Ingrid Bergman. Tells of a woman and her family who have lived in a refugee camp for ten years. They have had to rely on other’s charity because they could not work, and must wait to start new lives while others leave. The film ends as a challenge - the refugee camps will be burned as empty buildings if nations can give their help.

results.title: The Camomile lawn
results.creator_credit: ZED Ltd, Channel Four, ABC-TV (Australia), Glenn Wilhide, Sophie Balhetchet and Peter Hall
results.brief_description: It is August 1939, and Helena and Richard Cuthbertson with their young niece, Sophy, are preparing for the annual visit to Cornwall, where they meet with Richard’s other nephews and nieces - Oliver, Calypso, Polly and Walter. Sophy is resented by her aunt and has little in common with her invalid uncle, who lost a leg in the trenches. The cousins plan to run the ‘terror run’ - a fearless night-time dash along the cliff path. Helena and Richard invite Max and Monika Erstweiler - Austrian refugees to the ritual dinner before the ‘terror run’. Max is a renowned classical violinist, and he and Monika believe their only son is now in a concentration camp. The night is brought abruptly to an end by news from Polly and Walter’s father that the hospital where he is a surgeon is about to be evacuated. War must be imminent… Based on the novel by Mary Wesley. Stars Felicity Kendal and Paul Eddington.
